column4: can anybody help me restore ubuntu after editing with easybcd

i installed with wubi 9.04, then i booted vista and used easybc to edit bootloader name, there was a drop box with c,e,f, and boot under it i selected boot now ubuntu dont load anymore goes to a dos like screen and says wubi
Wubi NO!
Wubi not recommend by many people that know Ubuntu resonably well

I don't  fix weird wubi issues, because  well  weird wubi issues really are weird, and the standard stuff that applys to normal partitions, do not apply, for example being able to access the partition on a Live CD
so  in reply to your PM,  I am not going to help you with  fixing Wubi issues,  I would just advice into not using Wubi :)  and doing partitions for real
there is a way to access the wubi  file,  and it's files, but I don't have that link on me hummm
if you messed up  the bootloaders  so you can't boot up  Ubuntu/Wubi
maybe I am going to help after all a bit, but only if can find that link
you got data on there, that you want to get hold of?
well in that case remove wubi :)
and do partitions for real :)
remove Wubi :)
you can do a proper dual boot set up, it's not that difficult
maybe even get rid of Windows, or run in a virtual machine, depending on what you would be using Windows for or woudn't be using it for
if you can access Windows,  or sort it out so you can, you can remove wubi like that
DON'T use Wubi, use real partitions instead :)
why triple boot those?
you should only let Vista resize it's own partitions, and I assume this applys to Windows 7 to
otherwise possible dataloss, also you could virtual machine Windows 7
that Windows 7  RC come  1st March 2010 and it will start shuting itself down every 2 hours, then stop working in June
of course by then the real Windows 7 will be out anyway
also Windows 7 is really just Vista with some changes,   in fact it's even known as NT 6.1, where as Vista is known as NT 6.0, which confirms what I said
